PathAssistant.masterLabel: AH Sales - HRM Existing Org Opportunity

pathAssistantSteps.info: The customer has informed us that they are not moving forward with the opportunity.
The customer has returned the signed agreement and it has been countersigned. We've won the business, and can now focus on processing and implementation

Guidance For Success

The customer has engaged their stakeholders and have begun to evaluate their buying criteria, and issued an RFP if applicable. They have requested meetings and/or a live demo. The customer understands that the status quo is not sufficient, and has committed resources to exploring this purchase.


Exit Criterion

1. Schedule meeting or demo, engaging Enterprise Solutions as Needed.

2. Fill out additional details in opportunity fields 

3. Firm up room/user counts and other details needed to produce a quote. 

4. Fill out Discount Approval Notes with any initial discount requests. 

5. If a master or child opportunity, link with related parent/child opportunities

The customer has engaged their stakeholders and have begun to evaluate their buying criteria, and issued an RFP if applicable. They have requested meetings and/or a live demo. The customer understands that the status quo is not sufficient, and has committed resources to exploring this purchase.


Exit Criterion

1. Enter summary of opportunity into Notes to Sales field and other fields if data is known 

2. Fill in an approximate close date 

3. Set yourself a follow-up activity to reach out to discuss next steps.

Guidance For Success

The customer is in the process of comparing vendors and evaluating solutions. The customer has requested pricing or an ROI. You and the customer have discussed and there is mutual understanding around approval steps and potential timelines.


Exit Criterion

1. Request Contract or Proposal from Order Management; 

2. Prepare ROI if applicable - update Value Proposition Created/No Value Proposition Needed fields as applicable.

3. If consolidated order, relate accounts or chatter sales operations (greater than 15 accounts) 

4. Reassess and Modify Close Date

Guidance For Success

The customer is validating the ROI, negotating final terms; performing legal review; discussing implementation timelines in more details. They have committed implementation resources and budget, and are pursuing final contract and signature.


Exit Criterion

1. Receive signed contract;

2. Update all required contact roles (Bill To, Ship To, Customer Project Contact, Sponsor, Decision Maker), if not already outlined.

3. Fill in additional details to facilitate implementation in Notes to Subscription Management, Why did you purchase "X" product, Other related projects, Any Travel-Related Feedback fields;

4. If a consolidated order, allocate subscriptions to the related accounts or notify Sales Operations (greater than 15 properties)
